quiz1.explination: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language and was created by Tim Berners-Lee in 1990 while he was working at CERN
CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets, which is a style sheet language used for specifying the presentation and styling of documents written in markup languages

quiz1.questionText: Which image represents the HTML5 logo?
quiz1.explination: The HTML logo has a large number 5 as we are using HTML5

quiz1.questionText: What is the correct syntax for referring to an external JavaScript file?
quiz1.explination: To use an external script, put the name of the script file in the src (source) attribute of a <script> tag

quiz1.questionText: In HTML, which tag is used to define an unordered list?
quiz1.explination: An unordered list starts with the <ul> tag, each list item starts with the <li> tag

quiz2.questionText: Which of the following sorting algorithms can be used to sort a random linked list with minimum time complexity?
quiz2.explination: The slow random-access performance of a linked list makes other algorithms (such as quicksort) perform poorly, and others (such as heapsort) completely impossible.

quiz2.questionText: The following numbers are inserted into an empty binary search tree in the given order: 10, 1, 3, 5, 15, 12, 16. What is the height of the binary search tree (the height is the maximum distance of a leaf node from the root)?
quiz2.explination: The left side of the tree with have 1 as the left child of 10, 3 as the right child of 1, and 5 as the right child of 3

quiz2.questionText: Which image represents a graph data structure?
quiz2.explination: A tree is a hierarchical structure while graphs don't have to follow a hierarchical structure

quiz2.questionText: Which data structure is based on the Last In First Out (LIFO) principle?
quiz2.explination: It operates like a stack of objects, making it suitable for specific-order management

quiz2.questionText: What is the fastest time complexity?
quiz2.explination: The fastest time complexity is considered to be constant time, denoted as O(1)
